intro: Cheiridopsis cuprea, commonly known as the red sandmat, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit and small, fleshy leaves that store water. It produces vibrant yellow flowers during the spring and summer seasons. Cheiridopsis cuprea is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
